answers.answer: They usually suggest you eat iron rich foods unless your doctor tells you to take iron supplements.  You can get all the iron you need from specific foods.

The thing is most the time since I've been pregnant I don't have a really Big appetite. I do eat as much as possible but to be honest I can eat once or twice a day and I'll be full for the whole day: /
Yeah I wouldn't take a supplement unless the doc tells you its needed. I was told to take one with my first but i don't need one this time.
Don't take them if your doctor hasn't said anything. Your prenatals will have some iron in it. I'm almost 28 weeks and I was just now prescribed an iron supplement and only a certain amount.

You can get iron enriched cream of Wheat that saved me my first trimester with my morning sickness..it's really surprising how little you have to eat if you just eat the right things every now and then.

Dont take pills unless the Dr tells you too. They will check your levels when they test for gestational diabetes and if your levels r low and they are worried they will give you something but other then that your should be fine
Thanks for all the heads up ladies. I do just want the best for the baby .^

question: SO I had my first prenatal check up yesterday and as many questions I had for the doctor my mind totally went blank while I was there. So anyways I know iron is VERY important to give your baby. Any suggestions on some over the counter iron supplements to buy?
title: iron suppliments
